definitions.text: the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
a rosy color (especially in the cheeks) taken as a sign of good health
sudden brief sensation of heat (associated with menopause and some mental disorders)
a poker hand with all 5 cards in the same suit
the swift release of a store of affective force
examples: they got a great bang out of it
what a boot!
he got a quick rush from injecting heroin
he does it for kicks

definitions.text: a sudden rapid flow (as of water)
examples: he heard the flush of a toilet
there was a little gush of blood
she attacked him with an outpouring of words

definitions.text: sudden reddening of the face (as from embarrassment or guilt or shame or modesty)
turn red, as if in embarrassment or shame
examples: The girl blushed when a young man whistled as she walked by
The garbage flushed down the river

definitions.text: glow or cause to glow with warm color or light
examples: the sky flushed with rosy splendor
level the ground

definitions.text: rinse, clean, or empty with a liquid
examples: flush the wound with antibiotics
purge the old gas tank

definitions.text: irrigate with water from a sluice
examples: sluice the earth

definitions.text: cause to flow or flood with or as if with water
examples: flush the meadows

definitions.text: of a surface exactly even with an adjoining one, forming the same plane
examples: a door flush with the wall
the bottom of the window is flush with the floor

definitions.text: having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value
examples: an affluent banker
a speculator flush with cash
not merely rich but loaded
moneyed aristocrats
wealthy corporations
hit him flush in the face
set it flush with the top of the table
